unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Testing Hypothesis: Conditions
question_text: Which of the following is/are conditions necessary for a one-proportion $Z$ -test? I. The data must come from a random sample. II. $np$ and $n(1-p)$ must both be more than $10$ , where $n$ is the sample size and $p$ is the probability of success. III. The sample size must be more than $30$ .
